pros:
- The experience looks very good on the CV, helps you tremendously in getting a new job once you leave this company
- Lots of free time which can be used to learn new valuable skills and eventually get a better job
- There's an XBox available
cons:
- Forced employees to go to the office in the midst of a global pandemic until they get sick from Covid
- Start work at 9:00 and off work at 17:30, an additional 30 minutes of stay in the office unpaid
- Manager does not let you start work earlier at 8:00, no flexibility
- No promotion, no salary increase even if you do good in your performance evaluation. Bunch of employees hold the same job title doing the same tasks even after 3 years.
- You're not allowed to play with the XBox even during lunch breaks because "Lunch break is just for eating lunch."

pros: Working here allows you to work with the latest technologies and push your limits to the extreme, both for good and bad. Depending on the job and field, you may be able to travel, learn and meet great co-workers. Pay is good, career can be boosted by this experience.
cons:
Unfortunately, a lot of communication issues and cultural differences make the work environment extremely challenging. Many managers are young and from HQ, which makes things even harder. Career path is very unclear and personal development strategies aren't developed. Local HR is doing a wonderful job towards it, but even after years of pushing, no change is done. Research is extremely applied and the best ideas suffer from production level coding and technical debt.
Complete separation among teams, which don't like to share ideas and methods with others because they fear to be copied and competition. This last point is pushed to very high levels and stress is skyrocketing.

review_title: A good place to learn and combat hardships
pros:
You will learn lot of things here , Lot of technology resources available. Salary and bonus are also good . Be with the office politics to get your hike and bonus. If you are not part of that lobby , you will miss the pay.
Good security policies and tools are set up . But its already cracked under cover.
cons:
Huawei will keep you engaged 24hours , so u can forget family time , picnics & movies. You will be a big workaholic. 
The Covid time has stressful. they couldn't stretch beyond 24Hrs. 
You will get good designations & written appreciations. But work like a tech labour. 
They talk lot about cyber security & stuffs . but biggest violation is happening here. Every customer data is with every one & they use the same template to share with other projects. 
Managers face tough time because , if their team member does some mistake or questions the management , then his team leader or SDM will feel the heat from the business director. The heads are taught to work in such a way that no questions asked by any one , only work & work. 
 Some timepass directors introduce some innovative ideas that totally disrupt the teams morale and harmony. one such example is Digital factory.
Achieving 120% of your work is rated as normal & any thing below that is considered as an inefficient employee & needs to be fired.
Working for 14 years like a donkey for this company & finally just fires because they want to manage the budget. Even they hire 4 junior persons to replace 1 position. 
Big conflict of territory exists here .

job_title: Senior Ran Engineer in Copenhagen, Capital Region
pros: Exposure to latest technology, you learn a lot, professional and friendly colleagues, a HUGE chance for fresh graduates, no chance to get bored, a big step for future opportunity in your career (it depends on you). Danish way of work is more relaxed while still result and customer oriented. Sometimes business trips or training outside the country (for some is a Pro for others is a Con but 1-2 weeks of environment and city change is fine for me)
cons: Communication with other departments is quite difficult (need to send many emails, face to face meeting requests); only when the customer gets alerted then things move faster. Feeling of a constant pressure (it can be to not enough resources or bad planning). In some periods, work load is very high (some annual targets) for 1-2-3 months continuously, daily; you feel like you want to quit the job (sometimes no time for lunch) and no extra resources arrangements are made by the management. Salary increase is according to yearly evaluation, company results; mostly the salary you start will be the salary you will keep. You work only with one vendor (general for all vendor companies) so if you want to change company you need to learn the equipment/technology of the other vendor; so no much flexibility in job changing.

pros:
1)Competitive Salary 100000-200000 rubs/month for full-time. 
2)Flexible schedule
3)Medical insurance
4)Highly academic environment
5)Corporate events and celebrations
6)Extensive measures during a pandemic:
-remote work(provide with work-station)
-regular PCR testing for volunteers
-consultations with a doctor in the office
-masks, gloves, antiseptic, temperature checks
cons:
1)focus on candidates with higher degrees(Masters or PHD) and experience in research
2)a list of accomplishments is required
3)the first year - probation or internship. You work as an outsourced developer. If you prove useful they make a staff member.
4)English is necessary, Chinese will be very helpful. Communication with Chinese colleges is very frequent. A lot of corporate software and web resources are made in China and written in Chinese. There are issues with changing settings into English(sometimes it's not possible).
5) Project change frequently, sometimes a couple of times a year. Employees are required to learn new technologies(programming languages, toolchains, external tools, third-party libraries) fast. Little assistance from colleagues(they are in the same conditions).

All they want is to take all the technology expertise from the West and anywhere where there is something to take. During the years of working with Huawei, I witnessed harassment, sexual harrasment, bullying, discrimination based on sex, nationality, age, disabilities, skin color, race and religion. All actually by the Chinese management and Chinese expats. 

HR in the company also practices these, so when anyone tried to report misbehavior and illegal activities, the HR put you on the black list, so punished the person for bringing issues up. Huawei is seriously breaking the law, not fulfilling its obligations and compliance in any European country where it operates. I think it's a matter of time when this all comes to public. 

Everyone is too scared to talk, because the company is run by fear, lying, blackmail, blame, false accusations, harrasment in all forms, bullying, internal politics and just not to lose face in public.

Save yourself, don't even consider working for or with Huawei.

This is one of the fast growing company who cares customers and it's employee in a great way as a Happy employee create more happy customers. In my last 4 years of work experience I get opportunity in work different type of project and in different country that help me to grow faster and work in different type culture and environment. This company always focus on their Core Values and that is the baseline for all the decision making.  Here I also get many learning opportunity through dedicated learning source online e-class, e-lab, classroom and onjob training.
cons: No one perfect here and every organization have their own way of working style and principle to realize the organizational goal. This company always challenge us to push our limit. So If you like to broaden your boundary of your knowledge and skill then you will not complain anything here.

review_title: Highly stressful environment even down to resignation process
pros: Pay is okay, with PERKS for working OT.
cons:
Worst resignation process ever.  The job itself is already very stressful and demanding. Never imagine that the resignation process is equally stressful.
The resignation process requires supervisor approval, if not, it will not move forward. Although the contract clearly stated the notice period, it has no use here because the supervisor holds the absolute power in deciding the final notice period. Some poor staffs were dragged for six months. The supervisor also has the power in deciding whether to grant you the performance bonus for the previous year that you have contributed (even if the bonus is clearly stated in the offer) , and whether you can utilize your leave before you leave.
Your boss is bigger than the legal employment contract.

review_title: Great employer with lots of challenges
pros:
Huawei is a very challenging work environment, innovation and efficiency-driven. The culture is to provide the best to customers, to foster innovation, all together. Initiatives are welcomed, you're given responsibilities and autonomy from the very beginning, so you can work on your projects and join others, and really feel your added-value.
The diversity of works is very enriching. There are plenty of topics to work on everyday to keep you stimulated and thanks to which you'll always learn a lot. 
In addition, the international and multicultural environment makes the work environment even more delightful; people have different stories, cultural and work backgrounds to share, so the daily environment feels very humane. Working at Huawei is not only about enjoying the work or feeling stimulated to provide the best on the market, but it's also about all the different people, different cultures, especially the Chinese culture, the sharing of experiences, the curiosity and to learn from each other.

pros:
Core R&D, Opportunity to work in Multiple technology, High Focus on Innovation and Research.

Differentiator of Huawei with other company is "Work". The quality of Engineerin g work you get here is unmatched. Huawei serves the toughest customers with most complex usecases. There are ample opportunities to innovate out of the Box design and solutions. Their product development and Engineering process is quite matured and advanced.

There is lot of independence for an average Software Developer. Depending on performance and merit, people grow. I have seen many people in the company having exceptional growth. 

Also Huawei pays well and the hikes and Bonus are very generous (ofcourse depends on one's performance and contributions). As entire company is owned by Employees through internal stock option, the stock benefits at the hand of employee is much higher.

For freshers and entry level engineers, Huawei gives 2-3x growth opportunity. You dont have to worry of sitting idle anytime. 

Company has fighting spirit and handled difficult situations quite well. They strive to become No.1 in all the areas they work
cons: As accountability is high, you get more pressure some times
